content: I'm having trouble including classes that are namespaced when using hook_autoload_info(). If I try to use the namespaced version /namespace/class then it doesn't work. If I try the un-namespaced class classname it'll only work if I comment out the namespace in the class file (which I don't want to do). Anyone else know how to do this properly?
do you need to escape the slashes in the namespaced class? did you try that already?
@jenlampton good idea I haven't tried that yet

I found a combo that works.

So in hook_autoload_info() the namespace should be there like: 'MyNamespace\Myclass' => 'libraries/mylibrary/src/myclass.php', and then refer to the class like $myinstance = new \MyNamespace\Myclass();

I tried a few different combos including just referencing the class without namespace. I think in the end it was a mistake with the case of the namespace.
